resources.string: If you are new or have used BOMA! before, tap below.
To update, delete, or view progress,\n select a profile and tap below.

To update a profile, select the

profile name, then tap Update Profile.


To delete an old or unwanted profile, select

the profile name, then tap Delete Profile.


To view current progress, select a
 profile name, then tap View Progress.
Let\'s begin by setting up your profile…

string-array.name: gender_array
string-array.item: (Select a Gender)
Male
Female
Other

resources.string:
To update your profile,

adjust the listed values to

your current measurements,
 then tap below.
Tap below to view your profile
Tap below to return\n to main screen.
To learn more about BMI indices, tap below.
To view your BMI Progress,\n tap View Progress below.
BMI Reference Chart and Improvement Tips
A person\'s Body Mass Index (BMI) is calculated based on their height and weight, and can help determine which weight category the individual may fall under.
Children (2-19): Below the 5th Percentile.\n Adults: Underweight Category.
Children (2-19): 5th - 85th Percentiles.\n Adults: Normal Weight Category.
Children (2-19): Within or above the 95th Percentile.\n Adults: Obese Category.
Adults: Morbidly or Extreme Obese category.

string-array.name: improvement_suggestions
string-array.item: Walk 15 minutes daily.
Eat ample fruits and vegetables with your meals.
Make sure to eat a balanced meal.
Stretch for 10 minutes every hour.
Perform 10 push-ups, squats, and sit-ups daily.
Drink plenty of water daily.
Go jogging for 10 minutes
Do Jumping-Jacks for 10 minutes
Do push-up exercises for 10 minutes
Check with a dietitian about dietary habits/needs.
Request a physical from a doctor.
Research & hire a personal trainer
Exercise with friends/loved ones.
Find a sport you enjoy playing.
Pursue weightlifting to build lean muscle.
Pursue powerlifting to increase muscle mass.
Participate in a local charity marathon
Sit down to a home-cooked meal.

string-array.name: quotes
string-array.item:
"Success is not final,

failure is not fatal:

it is the courage

to continue that counts."
 - Winston Churchill

"Never bend your head.

Always hold it high.

Look the world

straight in the eye."
 - Helen Keller

\"Believe you can and\n
you\'re halfway there.\"\n - Theodore Roosevelt

"Life is like riding a bicycle.

To keep your balance,

you must keep moving."
 - Albert Einstein

"Nothing is impossible.

The word itself says

I'm possible."
 - Audrey Hepburn

"You are never too old

to set another goal or

to dream a new dream."
 - C.S. Lewis

"Sometimes you will never know

the value of a moment,

until it becomes a memory."
 - Dr. Seuss

\"You must do the things\n
you think you cannot do.\"\n - Eleanor Roosevelt

\"Be the change that you\n
wish to see in the world.\"\n - Mahatma Gandhi

"Let us make our Future now,

and let us make our dreams

tomorrow's reality."
 - Malala Yousafzai

"If I cannot do great things,

I can do small things

in a great way."
 - Martin Luther King Jr.

\"Spread love\n
everywhere you go.\"\n - Mother Teresa

"The best way to get started

is to quit talking

and begin doing."
 - Walt Disney

"The only limit to our

realization of tomorrow

will be our doubts of today."
 - Franklin D. Roosevelt

"Memories of our lives,

of our works and our deeds

will continue in others."
 - Rosa Parks

"How wonderful it is that

nobody need wait a single

moment before starting

to improve the world."
 - Anne Frank

"The best way to cheer

yourself up is to try to

cheer somebody else up."
 - Mark Twain

"It is better to offer

no excuse than

a bad one."
 - George Washington
